Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

Former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were poisoned in Salisbury, England (1), leading them to be offered new identities and possible help from the CIA (2). Yulia Skripal has since been released from the hospital (4). In response to the incident, Canada has ordered a review of Paris (3). The poisoning has raised concerns about food safety and the actions of certain Russian media outlets (2,3). Chelsea owner Roman Abramovich has also relocated to Israel and has become the country's richest citizen, possibly due to the incident (3).

Timeline.Text: UK authorities offer new identities and protection to Sergei and Yulia Skripal, who were poisoned in Salisbury, England.
UK investigators trace the source of the nerve agent used in the Salisbury poisoning to Russia's military, linking it to the 2016 poisoning of another Russian former agent in Ukraine.
Former CEO of Theranos Elizabeth Holmes is indicted on criminal charges by US federal authorities concerning the company's alleged corruption in securing the food chain.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===


The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal was a major news event in London, UK (1,2,3,4). The incident occurred on March 4, 2018 and it was believed to be carried out by two hitmen protected by Russian President Putin (3). The victims were 66-year-old former Russian agent Sergei Viktorovich Skripal and his 33-year-old daughter Yulia (1,4). The official explanation was that they were poisoned with a nerve agent (1). The incident led to increased tensions between Russia and the UK (4).

Timeline.Text: Former Russian agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia are hospitalized after a poisoning incident in London.
Sandra Barr discusses the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal and the official explanation of how they were poisoned.
A team of journalists from Express.co.uk discover that the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal was led by a two-man GRU team.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal was a targeted attempted murder using a nerve agent, which occurred in the United Kingdom (1, 2, 3). The Skripals were found critically ill in a park near the village of Porton in Salisbury (1). Despite their condition, they survived the attack (1). There has been speculation about who was behind the poisoning and why (2, 3). Some have compared this incident to the killing of Alexander Litvinenko in 2016 (3).

locations: Great Hall of the People in Beijing

Timeline.Text: Sergei and Yulia Skripal are allegedly poisoned with a nerve agent in Salisbury, UK.
Questions arise about who could be behind the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal.
British officials claim it is 'highly likely' that Russia is responsible for the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal, sparking a new Cold War.
Inconsistencies in the official statements regarding the poisoning raise doubts about the true culprits of the attack on Sergei and Yulia Skripal.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

The aspect of the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal that should be focused on is British Prime Minister Theresa May. She identified the chemical agent used in the attack (1) and led the investigation into the incident (2). May has also faced criticism for her handling of Brexit amidst the ongoing scandal (2,3). The victims of the poisoning remain in critical condition (3).

Timeline.Text: Sergei and Yulia Skripal are found unconscious in Salisbury, UK.
British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson accuses Russia of being responsible for the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal.
British Prime Minister Theresa May states that it is 'highly likely' that Russia was responsible for the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal.

Experts from the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) confirm that the nerve agent used in the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal was of a military-grade and developed in Russia.
Theresa May expels 23 Russian diplomats and imposes sanctions on Russia in response to the nerve agent attack on Sergei and Yulia Skripal.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

Sergei and Yulia Skripal remain critically ill after being poisoned (1, 2), with Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson pointing the finger of blame at Moscow (1, 2). Sergei Skripal was reportedly briefing Swiss intelligence for the US (4), and a new book claims that Yulia was a guest of the FSB in

Timeline.Text: Former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia are found unconscious in Salisbury.
British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson says that Britain is ready to provide any information Moscow wants about the Sergei Skripal poisoning.
More information is revealed about the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal as they remain critically ill.
British ministers, including Boris Johnson, boycott the Russian World Cup in response to the Skripal poisoning.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===


The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal in the United Kingdom sparked controversy and speculation (1,2). Sergei Skripal was a former Russian agent and MI6 asset (1,2). There were questions surrounding the source and intention of the poisoning, with some suggesting it could be a deliberate and conscious escalation (2,3). The UK government granted the OPCW's request for blood samples from the father and daughter (3).

Timeline.Text: Ex-Russian agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia are found poisoned in the UK.
Investigations reveal connections between Sergei Skripal and former US presidential candidate Hillary Clinton.
Rumors surface that Yulia Skripal may have possibly played a role in her father's poisoning.
Journalist Sandra Barr speculates on possible culprits behind the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal in Salisbury sparked retaliatory expulsions of diplomats from Russia in March of 2018 (3). Sergei, a former Russian agent and MI6 asset, and his daughter Yulia were poisoned with a nerve agent (1,2). The official explanation is that the nerve agent was found on the door of their suburban home (3).

Timeline.Text: 66-year-old former Russian agent Sergei Skripal and his 33-year-old daughter Yulia are found poisoned in Salisbury.
British police in protective suits investigate the suspected chemical attack on Sergei and Yulia Skripal.
Two Russians who were interviewed on TV say they visited Salisbury as tourists, sparking suspicion from investigators.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal, a former Russian spy and his daughter, was treated as a targeted attempted murder (2). The nerve agent used in the attack was analyzed by the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (1). The incident has sparked tension between the UK and Russia, with President Putin attending a concert in Moscow and discussions with Lithuanian President Dalia Grybauskaite in Davos (4). Amazon Prime Day 2018 was also affected as a result of the attack (3).

Timeline.Text: Blood samples from Sergei and Yulia Skripal are examined by the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons.
Sergei and Yulia Skripal are targeted specifically for attempted murder using a nerve agent.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

On March 4, 2018, Sergei and Yulia Skripal were poisoned with a nerve agent and targeted in an attempted murder (2). On April 23, 2018, blood samples were taken from the Skripals for examination by the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (1). The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal may have been a direct act or carried out by the UK (4).

Timeline.Text: Blood samples from Sergei and Yulia Skripal are analyzed in an effort to determine the cause of their poisoning.
Sergei and Yulia Skripal are identified as targets in an attempted murder.
The transfer of Russian diplomats from Perm is linked to the attack on Sergei Skripal.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal resulted in injuries and could potentially be connected to the Nazis (1). Initial investigations were focused on the use of a nerve agent (3) and Russia has denied involvement (2). Sergei Skripal's attack may serve as an example and has been compared to the case of Litvinenko (3). The family of the victims also suffered as a result of the poisoning (2).

Timeline.Text: The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal is described by a future political historian as a '21st century exemplar' of hypocrisy.
CCTV footage from a restaurant outside which Sergei and Yulia Skripal were poisoned is being examined by the UK police.
The public expresses doubts about the UK government's allocation of funds to public services after the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

There were conflicting reports and theories surrounding the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal (1,2,3). Some argue that it was a deliberate and conscious escalation of tension between Russia and the West (3). The last known location of the Skripals was revealed to be on Wilton Road in Salisbury (4).

Timeline.Text: Ex-Russian agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia collapse while out to dinner in Browder's England, in a suspected poisoning attack.
The Skripals are exposed to the nerve agent Novichok, resulting in their hospitalization in critical condition.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===
	
The poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal, which occurred on March 4, 2018, is believed to be the work of Russian agents (3). The Russian government denied involvement (3). In response to the incident, several countries have expelled Russian diplomats and severely strained relations with Russia (3). The Skripals were poisoned with a nerve agent, specifically A-234 (1). The British government has attributed the poisoning to Russia (4).

Timeline.Text: Sergei and Yulia Skripal are found critically ill in Salisbury, with the cause of their poisoning unknown.
Roman Abramovich is granted citizenship in Israel after a delay in his UK visa, possibly related to the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal.
Human Rights Watch accuses the Myanmar government of crimes against humanity, drawing attention to the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal as an example of such crimes.
Police discover the bodies of Sergei and Yulia Skripal in their Salisbury home, having been strangled to death.
Search teams find contaminated belongings of Skripal and police officers involved in the investigation of their poisoning.

Overview.Summary:
=== Summary ===

On March 4, 2018, a former Russian agent named Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were poisoned with nerve agent (A-234) in the village of Porton near Salisbury in the UK (2,3). The incident sparked discussions about possible culprits and the victims were offered new identities and protection with the help of the CIA (1). Sergei and Yulia survived the attack (2,3).

Timeline.Text: Former Russian agent, Sergei Skripal, and his daughter, Yulia, are offered new identities and relocated with help from the CIA.
Controversy surrounds the poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal, with theories ranging from involvement of spies to the influence of Russian media outlets.
